observations: The top-left portion of the grid contains numbers other than zero.
The non-zero numbers in each example are transformed such that the right-most of any sequence of numbers is transferred to where zeroes exist to the right
The rest of the grid is all zeros.
hypotheses: The rightmost number in a sequence of non-zero numbers is shifted further to the right, overwriting zero values until another non-zero number or the edge of the grid is encountered.
Non-zero numbers are rearranged such that the right-most number of each sequence is shifted to fill zero values to the right until the edge.
selected_rule: The rightmost number in a sequence of non-zero numbers is shifted further to the right, overwriting zero values until another non-zero number or the edge of the grid is encountered.
step_plan: Identify the rightmost number in each sequence of non-zero numbers within the input grid.
Shift that number to the right, overwriting any zeros encountered, until another non-zero number or the grid's edge is reached.
